caption:
This photograph captures a scene on a waterway, likely a river, with a backdrop that includes the skyline of a city. The immediate foreground features the edge of a large barge or vessel loaded with a massive amount of garbage. This pile of garbage is predominantly organic and mixed waste, containing items such as decomposing bags, materials, and miscellaneous refuse that suggests a collection from a highly populated urban area.

The left side of the image affords a view of the river and part of another adjacent vessel or barge, also seemingly filled with rubbish, lined with a sturdy metal barrier. In the upper right quadrant, the skyline is visible, characterized by tall buildings and a notable chimney emitting smoke, contributing to the industrial feel of the scenery. The sunlight is bright, creating a sparkle on the water's surface and casting shadows that enhance the textures of the garbage heap.

Reflections on the water indicate it is a sunny day. The overall environment suggests an industrial or urban setting involved in waste management and processing. The scene portrays a stark contrast between the natural waterway and the human-generated waste, emphasizing ongoing environmental and urban challenges.
title: Garbage is towed down the East River to Staten Island landfill, Manhattan in background.
